data.content:
I cannot believe this game is highly rated.  It's a cute interface and amuses for a while but after a few plays it's not all all engaging and just repeats.

For the price, it's shocking. In that bracket there are seriously great experiences to be had, even at 79p this would struggle to justify its cost.

The gameplay is very weak and I expect significantly more content for a £2.50 game.
data.title: Overpriced : 1hr entertainment

data.content: I like the dynamics and it is very interesting

data.content:
The game is nice and keeps me want to play. Issues: swiping doesn't feel responsive even on 6s. There's a delay, card doesn't follow finger and it's easy to make wrong move. Second problem, there's no state preservation, if you close app and open in 2 days, you start over.

I have feelings this issues caused by the fact that's Reigns available on different platforms, so there's not attention to iOS specific details, will try to purchase mostly iOS exclusives from now on.

data.content: ...all the kings have the same names and its a trifle outdated as Queens have ruled over kingdoms for many years yet they don't get a look in.  Females are just in the game to be rescued, married, have babies or be witches. It's 2016, we have thousands of years of history with both good and bad Kings & Queens sat on the throne, so the game should reflect that.  This game is basically ousting Queen's reigns from existence so perhaps the developers should have been focused on Pope reigns as there has never (yet) been a female Pope.

data.content: Ok there are so many spoilers ahead. I played this game. I enjoyed it, and then I found out how to end it. Trick the Devil. By myself, I found out how, and I was so prepared by the time the Devil arrived. Then my King died, as he does, and this Spirit says "Still no luck Tricking the Devil?" I say Yes, because if I hadn't I felt I'd end the game because if I said no it might think of that as giving up. So I said Yes and got the Bad Ending even though I would have made it if I survived a little bit longer.
data.title: So close...

data.content: This sort of shoddy game making is the problem with the games industry at large. It is unacceptable to present a piece of work for sale that is clearly unfinished or hasn't been fully tested. Pathetic. I would like a refund EDITOR. You must not have played the game you were recommending.
data.title: Why should I pay to be a beta tester

data.content:
So, I can appease the church, but then the army might come after me... I can keep the money lenders from taking over the kingdom, but the people are so powerful they've deposed me... And that's assuming I survived the dungeons, duels and dragon. Maybe I should have said yes to that crusade...

This is a funny and clever game, forcing you to try to maintain your rule with each king by balancing the church, people, military and money. Tied into that is an overarching quest to break a curse forcing you to be resurrected in every new ruler. The mechanics are simple: a card is turned over, requiring a response, and you swipe right for yes (mostly), or left for no. Yet there is a decent amount of strategy involved and the quest keeps you going.

The replay value is perhaps a little low, but this is a compelling and enjoyable piece of entertainment until you finally crack it.
data.title: Swipe right for medieval malarkey

data.content:
Not a game that you'll probably play for hours on end but enjoyable for a quick half hour.
Simple to play, my only issue is that the battery seems to get hammered!

data.content: I am slightly perplexed with peoples enthusiam for this game. I am not a shoot em up kinda of gamer and so thought that this may have a fun bit of strategy to it. It is effectively a card game with a number of scenarios that roll out of making decisions. Yes I have lived for up to 35 years and so I have tested it. Pick up/ put down and entirely forgetable. Further hugely overpriced for what it is.
data.title: Slightly Perplexed

data.content:
Nice game to play, very addictive! Animation and sound are great.
It's too glitchy at the moment, which causes huge frustration. Things like resetting stats and the card animation completely bugging out are awful and need fixing. There's nothing more frustrating than getting close to Reigning for 70+ years only to have the card animation completely bug out and then the death scene hang forcing a restart of the app, losing all of your achievements in that run.

The one time that this didn't happen, the game collected all my previous kings into one King with a 500 year reign. In summary, great game, but please fix these issues.

I am now stuck - need to arrange a honey moon, find the blood and loser a limb but no matter how many times I play I don't get a path which takes me to any of these events. I wonder if I got rid of a card earlier in the game which has left me in a dead end. Disappointing as otherwise it would be a five star game.

data.content: Reigns is a funny and amazing but difficult game that I am completely addicted to. I don't think there is really anything that needs to be improved but I look forward to seeing how this great game will grow.

data.content: This is an amazing and absorbing game, however when played a few times, can get repetitive. It is truly deep and makes you think about your actions. Will you let the witch sell her wares? The happiness of your population will increase but your religiousness will decrease. The deepness and witty humour will repeal the repetitiveness for a while, but the game ends up getting a bit stale. I also find it slightly unfair that the devil never returns, but that is a minor complaint. Overall Reigns is a great game and I definitely recommend buying. The tinder of Kings!
data.title: Excellent, but a bit repetitive.

data.content: ...Screen orientation issue with landscape is annoying and must surely be an oversight by author. Tried getting support but email bounced back! Having said that the is very enjoyable and it is a great idea.
data.title: Enjoyable but.....

data.content:
I think for the price tag it's a bit overrated. A lot of the decisions you need to make don't make any sense, so there is little feeling of reward if you do well, and it simply feels unjust if you die quickly - you'll just be left thinking, well, why though?

Also, it really is quite boring after a few rounds of the same questions/decisions. The game needs a lot more variety and the graphics should be vastly improved to justify the price tag at least! 

I think a lot of the great reviews could be from family/friends of the developers.
data.title: Overrated!

data.content:
Honestly, as tricky as the game is, this game is fun, addictive and really worth the price tag.

I only really have two problems with the game, of which both are pretty minor details that I'm sure would be worked on anyway:

1. When a king's name is passed on it would be cool to see like "Harry I", "George II", "James VI" etc.

2. When you die it would be a nice if the method that killed you was different, for example when you reach to the top of gold the way you always die is throwing a party and "eating too much, everyone was drunk and was unaware". If there were 4 or 5 for each category that would make things feel a lot fresher.

3. Third and finally, i'm not sure if this is already a feature in the game because of it being more of a technical point but, for example, one of the sons of the king who revolted and killed him became king after. I would think it to be a good detail if things were tougher for said new king because of his actions, so basically a character's actions can have consequences sort of thing.

Overall, great game and i'm looking forward to how it grows!!
data.title: Truly a great game

data.content:
Just superb. A brilliant concept, very well executed. Essential. 

I'm sure this will win many awards!
data.title: Genius

data.content: Witty and addictive. A tad repetitive at times but balancing the kingdom and not ending up dead after a few years reign is quite a challenge.
data.title: Hours of entertainment

data.content: Had some fun playing this afternoon since I downloaded, but in what can only be about an hour or so of play it's taken about 40% of my battery and when it is not more than fairly basic cartoon graphics, that doesn't seem right.
data.title: Fun game, but a battery guzzler

data.content: Interesting concept but gets repetitive quite quickly. Overpriced for what it is.
data.title: Reasonable, but nothing more.

data.content: Great game, but when duelling at the top, I can't see the white characters, which makes duelling very difficult... 😑
data.title: Good game, but bugs alert!

data.content:
It's a fun time waster if you happen to have a few minutes free during the day. 
It can be slightly confusing g at times but that adds to the charm I feel, the randomness of the cards you receive keeps the game interesting as you try and rule your kingdom, I'm looking forward to breaking my record of 60+ years as a King.
data.title: Great for short, repeated sessions .

data.content: It gets quiet repetitive after a few kings, same cards keeps popping up even if different answer is given, also far too easy to die.
data.title: A bit boring

data.content:
Simple format, but incredibly compelling story and outcomes. I've never been so invested in an iOS game. 

You are the king, and a mere swipe to the left or right decides your kingdoms fate for a year. Sounds almost dull but the variety of characters you meet, the precarious balancing of the impacts of different decisions and the gradual reveal of more characters, plot twists and events make it utterly enthralling.  

No adverts or in game purchases means you aren't constantly yanked out of the experience for the sake of a few extra dollars for the developers, and there is no forced 'wait-to-play' nonsense that ruins so many other games.
data.title: Best iOS game I've ever played

data.content: Taught me that good games are not all about graphics!
data.title: Simple but great fun!

data.content:
I like that you can pick this game up for five minutes or end up playing for longer. 

There is something addictive about trying to get all the different deaths and I also enjoy the unpredictability of some of the decisions.
data.title: Easy to play. Good humour. Nice art style.

data.content: Can come across as repetitive but gets highly addictive and I always find myself trying to beat my previous score
data.title: Good fun

data.content: As title suggests, bored after 20 minutes.
data.title: Bored after 20 mins

data.content: I spent a whole day playing this, I'm ded

data.content: Very clever, irreverently funny, a must download!

data.content: Surprisingly addictive. Well made, and engrossing!

data.content: Best game I've bought in a long time, totally addicting. Although sometimes it is too easy to die!
data.title: Amazing!!

data.content: What a Fantastic game. I was intrigued by the description and idea of this one and had checked a review before paying the price which I was somewhat concerned by. However, I can't recommend this game enough. You have to know what to expect as I fear some people may not appreciate how deep the game is at first glance. Fully recommend going for it though. Already love this one.
data.title: Top quality app

data.content:
I love this game. It's not only tricky and fun; it's also pretty funny with some great nerdy references. 
The gameplay is ludicrously simple...the political game you must play is anything but.
data.title: Simple, clever and addictive

data.content: It's a choose your own adventure rogue like card game full of wit and unexpected twists and turns. Love this!
data.title: Wow!

data.content: This game is legit fun, challenging and just a general good time consuming app. It can be difficult at first but that's the point, making sure your kingdom is kept well but not giving people too much power, so many options. Played for around 3-4 hours and I have only got 1/2 the cards. Only just won a game where I die of old age. Buy this if you want something to pickup and play from time to time!
data.title: Great

data.content: Great, fun little game.
data.title: Addictive

data.content: A waste of money! There is no purpose. I just cannot understand the rave reviews
data.title: Utterly pointless

data.content: But it's also a bit glitchy atm. Will raise to 5 on next update :)
data.title: It's really, really good

data.content: Great game, very entertaining
data.title: Great game!

data.content: I love this game- can't stop playing it even though I'm awful at the game😂.money well spent, if your thinking about buying this game and your looking through the reviews and you come across this one I would say to definitely get this game-DONT EXPECT ACTION AND MOVING A CHARACTER
data.title: Amazing

data.content: So you can play it landscape or portrait, but can't change the landscape orientation, simple thing please fix

data.content:
A choose-your-own-adventure rougelike? Colour me interested!

A rare and clever combination of genres. It's easy to get into and yet has a lot of depth.

Well worth your money IMHO.

Simple in design but is great fun

Could use a hard restart to go back to 602bc

data.content: I can't stop playing this game! Beautifully put together that plays excellently. Text that has incisive wit and charm. Highly recommended.
data.title: Clever, funny, addictive

data.content: A very interesting game. As king, the wellbeing of your citizens rests on the decisions you make. The consequences carry over from one king to the next and not all is as it seems...
data.title: Great game!

data.content: You can only swipe right for YES or left for NO. I am expecting questions but get statements like "You're people are hungry". That is not a question. How can I answer yes or no to that. Can't see point in game. Worst money ever spent on App.

data.content: This is a great little bundle of fun. Easy to play but challenging to win. Perhaps future add ons could be released at a premium for further content?
data.title: Innovative, fun and good value

data.content: Definitely worthwhile playing. Awesome fun and ludicrously addictive!
data.title: Seriously fun - really enjoying it!

data.content: This game is great at putting you under pressure and making you seriously think about your choices while managing to also be something while relaxing. Well fun, can't stop playing and trying to stay on the throne!
data.title: Amazing

data.content:
Really cool game!
Would recommend, gets repetitive, however with small details changed.
data.title: Great!

data.content:
Managed to get to 30 years so far, can't stop playing, very happy to give 5 stars. Sometimes frustrating the way the cards turn, but that is the best part of the game, it is so clever and yet simple. If they do updates that would just emphasise how great the developers are and how much effort they put into an enjoyable concept and game.

Thanks

data.content: I can't recommend this enough. I got my whole family playing it and it's great fun. Fantastic to see who can last the longest too. The cards are interesting as are the scenarios. Well worth the money!
